trans-unit.source: Invokes a standard [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_win#initcap](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-winsharpinitcap-md.md)] print dialog box that configures a <xref href="System.Printing.PrintTicket"></xref> and <xref href="System.Printing.PrintQueue"></xref> according to user input and then prints a document.
A user can use the **Print** dialog box to select a printer, configure it, and perform a print job.
Strictly speaking, you can use the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.PrintDialog.PrintDocument%2A> method without ever opening the dialog.
In that sense, the control can be used as an unseen printing component.

But for performance reasons, it would be better to use either the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue.AddJob%2A> method or one of the many <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter.Write%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter.WriteAsync%2A> methods of the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter>.
For more about this, see [How to: Programmatically Print XPS Files](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
Do not confuse this class, PrintDialog, with <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintDialog?displayProperty=fullName>.
The latter is used with Windows Forms applications.
PrintDialog is used with [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_wpf](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-wpf-md.md)] applications.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.PrintDialog"></xref> class.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the option to print the current page is enabled.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the option to print the current page is enabled; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets the highest page number that is allowed in page ranges.

Users who click **Print** when the **Print** dialog box is set to print pages outside the range that is set by the MaxPage and <xref:System.Windows.Controls.PrintDialog.MinPage%2A> values will get an error message advising them of the maximum and minimum page numbers.
Nothing will be printed.
A <xref:System.UInt32> that represents the highest page number that can be used in a page range in the **Print** dialog box.
The property is being set to less than 1.
Gets or sets the lowest page number that is allowed in page ranges.

Users who click **Print** when the **Print** dialog box is set to print pages outside the range that is set by the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.PrintDialog.MaxPage%2A> and MinPage values will get an error message advising them of the maximum and minimum page numbers.
Nothing will be printed.
A <xref:System.UInt32> that represents the lowest page number that can be used in a page range in the **Print** dialog box.
The property is being set to less than 1.
Gets or sets the range of pages to print when <xref:System.Windows.Controls.PrintDialog.PageRangeSelection*> is set to <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.PageRangeSelection"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.PageRange"></xref> that represents the range of pages that are printed.

The <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.PageRange"></xref> object that is being used to set the property has either the beginning of the range or the end of the range set to a value that is less than 1.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.PageRangeSelection"></xref> for this instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.PrintDialog"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.PageRangeSelection"></xref> value that represents the type of page range to print.
Gets the height of the printable area of the page.
A <xref:System.Double> that represents the height of the printable page area.
Gets the width of the printable area of the page.
A <xref:System.Double> that represents the width of the printable page area.
Prints a <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.DocumentPaginator"></xref> object to the <xref href="System.Printing.PrintQueue"></xref> that is currently selected.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.DocumentPaginator"></xref> object to print.
A description of the job that is to be printed.
This text appears in the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_ui](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-ui-md.md)] of the printer.
documentPaginator is .
Gets or sets a <xref href="System.Printing.PrintQueue"></xref> that represents the printer that is selected.
The <xref href="System.Printing.PrintQueue"></xref> that the user selected.

Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Printing.PrintTicket"></xref> that is used by the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.PrintDialog"></xref> when the user clicks **Print** for the current print job.
Neither setting nor getting this property validates the <xref:System.Printing.PrintTicket>.
To validate it use <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue.MergeAndValidatePrintTicket%2A>.
A <xref href="System.Printing.PrintTicket"></xref> that is used the next time the **Print** button in the dialog box is clicked.
Setting this PrintTicket property does not validate or modify the specified <xref href="System.Printing.PrintTicket"></xref> for a particular <xref href="System.Printing.PrintQueue"></xref>.

If needed, use the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue.MergeAndValidatePrintTicket*> method to create a <xref href="System.Printing.PrintQueue"></xref>-specific <xref href="System.Printing.PrintTicket"></xref> that is valid for a given printer.
Prints a visual (non-text) object, which is derived from the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Visual"></xref> class, to the <xref href="System.Printing.PrintQueue"></xref> that is currently selected.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Visual"></xref> to print.
A description of the job that is to be printed.
This text appears in the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_ui](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-ui-md.md)] of the printer.
visual is .
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the option to print the selected pages is enabled.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the option to print the selected pages is enabled; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Invokes the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.PrintDialog"></xref> as a modal dialog box.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if a user clicks **Print**; <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> if a user clicks **Cancel**; or <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> if a user closes the dialog box without clicking **Print** or **Cancel**.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether users of the **Print** dialog box have the option to specify ranges of pages to print.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the option is available; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
